attributes.action: Either abandon the 'Britishness' test that all non-Europeans are forced to take to stay in this country, or make the test compulsory to all British people in order to determine a benchmark
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I have two issues with the policy regarding the 'Britishness' test.

1) 'Britishness' is not a word and before you begin judging hard 
working citizens of this country on the basis of their language skills 
or cultural background, we really should reconsider using terms like 
'Britishness'.

2) I have just sat a sample test and scored 3/10, does this mean I should 
be deported? This is my big problem with this test. The questions are absolutley ludicrous 
and clearly designed to exploit more and more money out of people who 
are clearly trying to make their way in life.

This is clearly another money making exercise fresh out of the Labour 
portfolio, designed to exploit the under-supported in our society. If 
people such as myself do not speak up, nobody will. As a country we are 
a disgrace, as a government, this one is beyond the limits of human 
decency. If we insist on 'testing' those who choose to come to our 
country, bringing not only skills but also economy, then we must also 
test the British people; otherwise what is the benchmark? By what 
standard are you measuring thses people: their knowledge of this once 
great land or the size of their wallets?
